Class ConsoleApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConsoleApp
  • public class ConsoleApp
extends java.lang.Object

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ConsoleApp()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addFlight()
      Adds a new flight based on user-provided information.
      void cancelFlight()
      Cancels a flight by setting its status to "CANCELLED" and notifying all relevant components (airport, terminals, gates).
      void changeGate()
      Changes the gate for a specific flight by updating its gate information in the relevant terminal and gate components.
      void createObjects()
      Creates the objects used for the simulation.
      void delayFlight()
      Delays a flight by updating its status across the airport, terminals, and gates.
      void displayMenu()
      Displays the options available in the console.
      void displayPrompt()
      Displays the choice menu, waits for the user input, and calls the appropriate method.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Creates all the objects and starts the simulation.
      void notifyBoarding()
      Notifies all relevant components that a specific flight is ready for boarding by changing its status to "BOARDING" and triggering notifications to the airport, terminals, and gates where the flight is located.
      void removeFlight()
      Removes a flight from the system by finding it across the airport, terminals, and gates, and then removing it from each relevant component.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsoleApp

        public ConsoleApp()

    • Method Detail

      • createObjects

        public void createObjects()
        Creates the objects used for the simulation. DO NOT EDIT

      • addFlight

        public void addFlight()
        Adds a new flight based on user-provided information.

      • delayFlight

        public void delayFlight()
        Delays a flight by updating its status across the airport, terminals, and gates. The method prompts the user for flight details (company and flight number) and updates the status of the flight to "DELAYED" in relevant components.
        Throws:
        InputMismatchException - if the user enters invalid input for company or flight number.

      • changeGate

        public void changeGate()
        Changes the gate for a specific flight by updating its gate information in the relevant terminal and gate components. The method ensures that the requested gate is available before making the change, and it notifies the necessary observers.
        Throws:
        InputMismatchException - if the user enters invalid input for company, flight number, terminal, or gate number.

      • cancelFlight

        public void cancelFlight()
        Cancels a flight by setting its status to "CANCELLED" and notifying all relevant components (airport, terminals, gates). It updates the system's status across all components where the flight is located.
        Throws:
        InputMismatchException - if the user enters invalid input for company or flight number.

      • notifyBoarding

        public void notifyBoarding()
        Notifies all relevant components that a specific flight is ready for boarding by changing its status to "BOARDING" and triggering notifications to the airport, terminals, and gates where the flight is located.
        Throws:
        InputMismatchException - if the user enters invalid input for company or flight number.

      • removeFlight

        public void removeFlight()
        Removes a flight from the system by finding it across the airport, terminals, and gates, and then removing it from each relevant component. It ensures that the flight is properly removed from all locations in the system.
        Throws:
        InputMismatchException - if the user enters invalid input for company or flight number.

      • displayMenu

        public void displayMenu()
        Displays the options available in the console. DO NOT EDIT

      • displayPrompt

        public void displayPrompt()
        Displays the choice menu, waits for the user input, and calls the appropriate method. DO NOT EDIT

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Creates all the objects and starts the simulation. DO NOT EDIT
